intro: Wiborgia spinosa, commonly known as the spiked wiborgia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, spiny stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Wiborgia spinosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
